abstract.p: Letter from Kelli Conlin, executive director of National Abortion and Reproductive Rights Action League, says forced pregnancy is something that no civilized society should aspire to (July 5 Thomas Lynch Op-Ed article)

block.p: Re ''A Man's Right to Choose'' (Op-Ed, July 5):
Re ''A Man's Right to Choose'' (Op-Ed, July 5):

I agree with Thomas Lynch that reproductive choice should be a human issue and not considered only a woman's issue. But he fails to take into account two critical points when he makes his case that men should have equal say over whether a woman carries a pregnancy to term or has an abortion.

The first is the cultural reality throughout civilized history that women have carried the primary responsibility for child rearing, especially in the situation where fathers show little or no interest in being involved.

The second is biological. Until we reach that point where women's bodies are not the vehicle for conception and childbirth, it is absolutely appropriate for a woman to have the exclusive decision on whether her body should be used for such a purpose. Forced pregnancy is something that no civilized society should aspire to.
The writer is executive director, National Abortion and Reproductive Rights Action League, New York State.
